ygData.subject: Re: Cleric Sit-in
ygData.msgSnippet: um no pammy my day will not come =0), for one reason only I REFUSE to do the quests!!! also i NEVER laugh at another s misfortune ( hmm not to say that i dont
ygData.messageBody:
um no pammy my day will not come =0), for one reason only I REFUSE to do the
quests!!! also i NEVER laugh at another's misfortune ( hmm not to say that i
dont laugh at you in general sweety) but folks Pam raises all valid points,
cleric quests are time-consuming, the items are not that great, and lastly
ya gotta be close to 30 to do them------BAH i say and we need wisdom not
intel *end rant*
Topaaz
xegony


>From: Pam <adira399@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Cleric Sit-in
>Date: Tue, 30 Nov 1999 08:50:39 -0800 (PST)
>
>Count me in on the sit in! Although some of the
>cleric items seem decent enough, the simple fact that
>we are expected to watch for ground spawns disgust me!
>
>The first time I waited for a ground spawn, I was in
>Kithicor (this was before all the undead was
>introduced there). I had been sitting all by my
>lonely for 3 hours (at least) and nothing happened.
>Unfortunately, I had to run afk. By the time I got
>back there was a /tell from someone saying that they
>picked up the item while passing through. BAH.
>
>Last night we were hunting undead in Kithicor. It was
>morning in the game and I decided to check that spot
>since our "puller" said it looked like a bag was
>sitting on the ground. Well, I got excited and ran
>over there. Heh, not a good idea, i tell ya... Even
>tho most of the mobs in kith con blue to me, they are
>horrible to even attempt to solo. Needless to say I
>got splattered to the ground and lost my level.
>Happened the second time too! (no laughing at me
>Topaaz, your day will come as mine did!)
>
>I have also died in MistMoore while waiting for the
>ground spawn in there and I cant even attempt to find
>the named gobbo in the Cauldron without a druid with
>me. To this day I haven't any of my ingots or icons.
>I dont feel like dedicating weeks of time just for
>ground staring. Although I would love the added AC, I
>feel that my wisdom enhancing clothing will have to do
>for now.
>
>Adira SoulSaver
>Bandaid of Tunare (blessed 37 times)
>Rodcet NIfe
>--- Anne O <topaaz1@...> wrote:
> > here here, well said Jeff, i agree i want more
> > wisdom. i refuse to do the
> > quests, as far as im concerned AAC is useless to me
> > in comparison to the
> > wisdom i need, legs with intel=rediculas!!! plain
> > and simple.....
> > topaaz
> > xegony
> >
> >
